quiz.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.

questions.question: What is diversification?
options: Spreading investments across different assets, sectors, and geographies to reduce risk
Investing all money in one stock
questions.explanation: Diversification is the practice of spreading your investments across different assets, sectors, and geographies to reduce risk.

questions.question: Who developed Modern Portfolio Theory?
questions.explanation: Modern Portfolio Theory was developed by Harry Markowitz, who mathematically proved that diversification can reduce risk without necessarily reducing returns.

questions.question: How many main sectors is the stock market divided into?
questions.explanation: The stock market is divided into eleven main sectors including Technology, Healthcare, Financials, Consumer Discretionary, Consumer Staples, Energy, Industrials, Materials, Real Estate, Utilities, and Communication Services.

questions.question: Which sectors tend to outperform during economic growth?
questions.explanation: During economic growth, Consumer Discretionary and Technology often outperform because people spend more on non-essentials and technology.

questions.question: Which sectors tend to hold up better during recessions?
questions.explanation: Consumer Staples and Utilities tend to hold up better during recessions because people still need food and electricity regardless of the economy.

questions.question: If you own 20 companies across different industries and one fails, what percentage of your portfolio have you lost?
questions.explanation: If you own 20 companies equally weighted and one fails, you've only lost 5% (1/20) of your portfolio.

questions.question: What is the suggested range of stocks for adequate diversification for individual stock pickers?
questions.explanation: Most experts suggest ten to thirty stocks provides adequate diversification for individual stock pickers.

questions.question: Which sector includes companies like Apple and Microsoft?
questions.explanation: Technology sector includes Apple, Microsoft, and other software and hardware companies.

questions.question: What does REIT stand for?
questions.explanation: REIT stands for Real Estate Investment Trust, which are property companies that distribute rental income to investors.

questions.question: What is the risk of over-diversification?
options: Diluting returns from your best ideas
questions.explanation: If you own too many individual stocks, you dilute your returns from your best ideas and might as well just own an index fund.
